A.M. No. 02-8-11-SC              August 13, 2002


In re: REORGANIZATION OF THE DIVISIONS OF THE COURT


WHEREAS
, under Article VIII, section 4, paragraph (1) of the Constitution, the Supreme Court may sit en banc or in divisions of three, five, or seven Members; and since the effectivity of the Constitution, the Court has been sitting en banc and in three divisions of five Members each;


WHEREAS
, in view of the appointment of new Members of the Court, and the expected appointment of three more for the vacancies created by the retirement of Honorable Associate Justices Jose A. R. Melo, Sabino R. de Leon, Jr. and Santiago M. Kapunan, there is need to reorganize the three Divisions of the Court conformably with its policy to attain balance among the Divisions on the basis of seniority and other relevant considerations.


NOW, THEREFORE
, the Court hereby RESOLVES to reorganize, as it hereby REORGANIZES, its three Divisions. As reorganized, the Divisions shall be composed of the following:


FIRST DIVISION
Chairman: Chief Justice HILARIO G. DAVIDE. JR.




Members:
Associate Justice JOSE C. VITUG
Associate Justice CONSUELO YNARES-SANTIAGO
Associate Justice ANTONIO T. CARPIO


SECOND DIVISION
Chairman: Senior Associate Justice JOSUE N. BELLOSILLO


Members:
Associate Justice VICENTE V. MENDOZA
Associate Justice LEONARDO A. QUISUMBING
Associate Justice MA. ALICIA AUSTRIA-MARTINEZ


THIRD DIVISION
Chairman: Associate Justice REYNATO S. PUNO


Members:
Associate Justice ARTEMIO V. PANGANIBAN
Associate Justice ANGELINA SANDOVAL-GUTIERREZ
Associate Justice RENATO C. CORONA




The three new Associate Justices who would be appointed to succeed Honorable Justices Jose A. R. Melo, Sabino R. de Leon, Jr. and Santiago M. Kapunan shall be assigned to the Divisions in accordance with the policy on the matter.


This Resolution shall take effect on the first day of September 2002, and shall be published in a newspaper of general circulation in the Philippines before 20 August 2002.
